alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 1:11PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Choctaw, Washington, northwestern Clarke, eastern Wayne and northeastern Greene Counties through 200 PM CST... At 111 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Waynesboro to 9 miles southwest of Silas to 5 miles northeast of Buckatunna to 10 miles southwest of State Line. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Waynesboro, Butler, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Clara, Tibbie, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas, Fruitdale, Coffeeville, Gilbertown and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
